Je mehr verschiedene Informationen du in die Modelle einbringen kannst, desto besser die Prediction.

Inspirierende Aussagen aus dem Podcast

"Ein Agent ist im Prinzip wie meine zehnj√§hrigen Kinder: Ich sage ihnen, was ich erreichen will, und hoffe, dass sie rausfinden, wie sie dahin kommen ‚Äì ohne dass ich jeden Schritt vorgeben muss."

"Es gibt momentan sehr viel Agent-Washing. Nicht alles, was als Agent verkauft wird, ist wirklich agentic. Wenn du es mit einem Workflow l√∂sen kannst, solltest du das tun."

"Wir steuern in eine Welt, in der Code schreiben schneller geht als Code lesen. Das stellt uns vor fundamental andere Probleme."

"Der Wow-Effekt mit Agenten ist heute schnell erreicht. Die eigentliche Arbeit beginnt danach ‚Äì beim Produktisieren und Enterprise-Ready-Machen."

"Kontext ist key ‚Äì nicht nur f√ºr LLMs und Agenten, sondern auch f√ºr uns Menschen. Zu verstehen, was drumherum abgeht, ist die Grundlage f√ºr Adaptability."

"Bei Agenten musst du dir immer fragen: W√ºrde ich diese Aufgabe so auch an mein Team geben? Wenn nicht, solltest du es auch keinem Agenten √ºberlassen."

"Je mehr verschiedene Informationen du in die Modelle einbringen kannst, desto besser die Prediction. Deshalb sind World Models so spannend."

Konkrete Tipps f√ºr die Praxis

F√ºr den Start:

  • Beginne mit Experimenten ‚Äì baue oder nutze einen Agenten, um ein Gef√ºhl f√ºr die Technologie zu bekommen

  • Probiere Standard-Agenten aus, um zu sehen, was m√∂glich ist und wie schnell sie in deinem Unternehmen akzeptiert werden

  • Schaue dir dein Backlog an: Welche geplanten Features k√∂nntest du mit Agenten neu denken?

F√ºr die Entwicklung:

  • Nutze das Joule Studio f√ºr schnelle Prototypen mit Enterprise-Grade-Features

  • Denke in Outcomes, nicht in Schritten ‚Äì beschreibe, was erreicht werden soll, nicht wie

  • Statte Agenten mit den richtigen Tools aus, aber √ºberfrachte sie nicht ‚Äì zu viele Tools verschlechtern die Qualit√§t

  • W√§hle das passende Modell: klein und g√ºnstig f√ºr einfache Tasks, leistungsstark f√ºr komplexe Reasoning-Aufgaben

F√ºr die Skalierung:

  • Starte mit vielen kleinen Human-in-the-Loop-Checkpoints und reduziere sie schrittweise

  • Baue technische Checks (Evals) auf, wenn menschliche Checks weniger werden

  • Implementiere Monitoring, Observability und Audit-Logs von Anfang an

  • Denke an Governance: Was passiert bei Fehlern? Wie verhinderst du Endless-Loops?

F√ºr die Strategie:

  • Priorisiere Use Cases nach Business Value, nicht nach technischer Coolness

  • Unterscheide klar: Workflow oder Agent? Nutze Agenten nur dort, wo Flexibilit√§t und Dynamik n√∂tig sind

  • Bleibe adaptiv und unabh√§ngig von einzelnen Modellen oder Frameworks

  • Investiere in gute Datengrundlagen ‚Äì die richtigen Daten zur richtigen Zeit sind entscheidend

Res√ºmee: Die Zukunft ist agentic ‚Äì aber mit Augenma√ü

KI-Agenten sind keine Science-Fiction mehr, sondern Realit√§t im Enterprise-Kontext. Bei SAP sind sie bereits in allen m√∂glichen L√∂sungen announced, von Finance √ºber HR bis zu technischen Use Cases. Die Technologie ist beeindruckend einfach von der Bedienung aber sehr m√§chtig: Agenten k√∂nnen komplexe Aufgaben eigenst√§ndig l√∂sen, sich dynamisch an ver√§nderte Bedingungen anpassen und Prozesse augmentieren, die fr√ºher viel manuelle Arbeit erforderten.

Aber ‚Äì und das ist die zentrale Botschaft von Jochen Schneider ‚Äì nicht alles sollte oder muss zum Agenten werden. Die Kunst liegt darin, zu erkennen, wo Agenten echten Mehrwert schaffen und wo klassische Workflows effizienter sind. Es geht nicht darum, dem Hype zu verfallen, sondern Business Value zu schaffen und Probleme zu l√∂sen, die heute nicht oder nicht so gut l√∂sbar sind.

Und was man sieht: viele Inhalte der vergangene Gespr√§che im Podcast von KI Ethik, humanzetrierten Design oder KI Strategie sind auch im Kontext von Agenten zentral. BTW: Lernangebote speziell f√ºr den SAP AI Bereich haben hier im Blog gesammelt. 

Ich habe mich auf diesen Podcast mit Recherche und einem E-Learning von deeplearning.ai zu AgenticAI vorbereit. Der n√§chste Schritt ist, dass ich mir eigene Agenten bastele. Mir f√§llt es noch einfacher, Business Use Cases zu sehen anstatt f√ºr den pers√∂nlichen Gebrauch - denn mir reichen oft GPTs oder eben das Nutzen von verschiedenen LLMs.

entry.title: Build Business-Grounded AI Agents, Faster
entry.content:
At Sapphire 2025, SAP announced Joule Studio, a capability in SAP Build that enables developers to create Joule agents and skills. Deeply grounded in business data, these agents orchestrate workflows across heterogenous landscapes to deliver accurate outcomes. Joule Studio delivers an agent runtime with built-in data protection guardrails, multi-LLM support, and context retention across tasks for scalable, secure execution.  

Today, we are announcing additional capabilities that will equip developers with a comprehensive development tool kit to build scalable agentic AI for their business. We are introducing vibe coding experience to create not only conversational but also system-triggered AI agents. Instead of building from scratch, developers can also extend ready-to-use Joule agents as per their business needs. Joule Studio will also support open standards such as Model Context Protocol (MCP) and Agent2Agent (A2A) protocol. These advances empower developers to deliver end-to-end agentic automation with greater speed, flexibility, and control. See what our customers and partners from the beta program (Q3 2025) have to say: 

‚ÄúWith Joule Studio, we could build powerful agents in three weeks. It is an intuitive, no‚Äëcode environment that enables system connectivity across SAP and non‚ÄëSAP critical environments, for a hybrid landscapes where data resides in multiple modules.‚Äù 

 - Gianluca Simeone, VP - Global SAP CTIO and Gen-AI Leader at Capgemini 

‚ÄúNestle, SAP, and IBM worked together on a supply chain Agentic AI PoC. With the agent builder capability in Joule Studio, we created this POC bringing in data from SAP and non-SAP sources to create an agent that will automate our complex Order fulfillment processes‚Äù  

- Pablo Nill, Sr Product Group Manager, Nestle  

 ‚ÄúWith Joule Studio, agentic innovation moves closer to the heart of operations. At KPMG, we‚Äôre helping to shape trusted solutions that transform business context into measurable value by building specialized AI agents for fulfillment orchestration, supply chain management, and more‚Äù. 

 - Valentino K√∂ster, Global Head of SAP360 Program & AI, KPMG AG WPG, Germany 

Fast‚ÄëTracking Ideas into Agents: Empowering Developers with AI 

To lower the barrier to AI adoption, Joule Studio provides AI assistance in the design-time experience of creating agents. Developers can use natural language to share their requirements with Joule copilot and get contextual recommendations for agent definition, tools, and other configurations, tailored to their specific needs. For example, Joule may suggest and add relevant Joule skills to custom Joule agents. This makes agent creation more accessible and accelerates time-to-value. 

Image 1: AI-assistance in Joule Studio

Cross-Ecosystem Integration with Model Context Protocol (MCP) 

One of the most significant updates is Joule Studio‚Äôs support for MCP, an open standard that provides a unified way to connect AI agents with external systems. This breaks down traditional application silos and enables cross-platform agent execution. In Joule Studio, you can configure connectivity to external MCP servers, allowing agents to use third-party tools and applications. For example, a support agent that you built in Joule Studio can retrieve ticket information from a third-party IT service platform exposed via MCP. This open integration empowers AI agents to act as central, intelligent orchestrators, managing complex workflows across diverse systems without the need for custom integrations.  

Image 2: Configuration of tools, MCP servers, and models for agent design

Proactive Agentic Automation with System-Triggered Agents 

Joule Studio will support the creation of system-triggered AI agents that operate autonomously with no human input. Triggers such as business events, APIs, and schedules will be supported for agents to be initiated. This elevates agents from being reactive to proactive collaborators, capable of initiating actions like inventory monitoring and initiating purchase orders for low stock items or incident response. That enables true end-to-end automation of business processes with minimal human intervention.  

Image 3: Add triggers for custom agents

Adapt Pre-Built, SAP-Delivered Agents to Your Enterprise  

In Joule Studio, developers will be able to extend ready-to-use Joule agents by adding additional tools and custom skills as pre- and post-processing steps. For example, extend an Accounts Receivable Agent, which analyzes overdue receivables and follows up with customers, by grounding it in your order handling policy for informed decision making. This allows you to tailor ready-to-use Joule agents to your unique business requirements.

Image 4: Extending ready-to-use Joule agents 

Getting Started with agent builder in Joule Studio

The agent builder will be generally available in December 2025 with support for MCP, agent as a tool, vibe coding, and document grounding part of first release. Later in 2026, we will release support for agent extensibility, system-triggered agents, A2A, and agent observability.

entry.title: Introducing the Next Era of ABAP Development
entry.content:
At SAP TechEd 2025, we announced four key innovations that redefine the ABAP Cloud development experience:

Key highlights:

  • ABAP is entering the era of Agentic AI
  • ABAP LLMs will be available on GenAI Hub
  • ABAP AI capabilities will be supported in earlier releases (SAP S/4HANA 2021 and later)
  • ABAP is embracing an open IDE strategy ‚Äî with Visual Studio Code (VS Code) for ABAP on the way

These innovations mark a major step forward in making ABAP development even more intelligent, flexible, and efficient.

Generative AI has already profoundly changed our world. The arrival of Agentic AI marks the beginning of a major technological transformation. We are entering a new era. For enterprise development, this means rethinking the very foundations of our programming models while upholding SAP‚Äôs core commitments to security, scalability, and reliability.

At SAP TechEd 2025, the spotlight is on how AI and Agentic capabilities are revolutionizing ABAP development. By embracing these advancements, developers can unlock intelligent automation, boost productivity, and build smarter, more resilient enterprise solutions.

 

A New Era for ABAP Development

ABAP is evolving alongside rapid advances in AI and development tooling. With these new innovations, we are extending the reach of ABAP AI, enabling agentic development, and delivering a modern, IDE-agnostic experience. 

 

ABAP - Now Powered by Agentic AI

Today, ABAP AI capabilities are available as individual Joule skills, offering valuable automation and insights to developers. To further enhance the development workflow and unlock new levels of productivity, we are introducing Agents for ABAP. All agents will be able to interact with one another through a new Agentic AI architecture in ABAP‚Äôs backbone technology components. With this innovation, ABAP coding agents will actively assist developers throughout the entire development process ‚Äî from code generation to refactoring and transformation ‚Äî enabling seamless end-to-end automation and agentic collaboration.

A new ABAP MCP server will expose ABAP development capabilities, both with and without embedded AI, to agents. Existing ABAP AI use cases will be refined and offered as tools or as dedicated ABAP agents via MCP.

Imagine an ABAP development experience where intelligent agents actively support you every step of the way‚Äîboosting productivity and accelerating development tasks through smart, agentic assistance.

General availability is planned for Q2, 2026. The initial scope focuses on VS Code for ABAP, with ABAP Development Tools for Eclipse to follow.

 

ABAP AI LLMs on GenAI Hub

To empower customers and partners to build custom, AI-driven developer productivity use cases, we will make our ABAP AI large language models (LLMs) available on the GenAI Hub.

Trained on more than 250 million lines of ABAP code, 30 million lines of CDS code, and extensive technical documentation, these LLMs are purpose-built to explain and generate (ghost text) modern ABAP code.

Release is planned for Q4 2025, underscoring our commitment to openness and collaboration within the SAP ecosystem.

 

Availability of ABAP AI Capabilities in Lower Releases

(SAP S/4H2021, 2022, and 2023)

AI-driven development is transforming how organizations extend SAP S/4HANA. To make AI available more broadly, ABAP AI capabilities will soon be offered for SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Private Edition.  From a technology perspective, we will follow a release independent approach by offering ABAP AI capabilities as an application that can be deployed side-by-side.

This allows ABAP developers in S/4HANA systems to increase productivity, accelerate custom code transformation, and continuously access the latest capabilities ‚Äî all while keeping their core system stable. The real strength of this new ABAP AI application is that it will be combined with the Agentic AI tooling described above.

General availability is planned for Q2 2026, marking a significant milestone in making AI innovation more accessible to every S/4HANA customer.

 

VS Code for ABAP is coming

To meet developers where they are, ABAP Cloud development is coming to Visual Studio Code ‚Äî one of the world‚Äôs most widely used IDEs.

 

The new ABAP Cloud Extension for VS Code delivers a streamlined, file-based development experience with built-in AI assistance. It is powered by an ABAP language server, initially supporting Fiori UI Service development and expanding to additional ABAP Cloud scenarios over time.
This move brings ABAP development into the same environment where developers already build with UI5 and CAP, enabling a unified, AI-enhanced experience across SAP technologies. Eclipse for ABAP will remain our flagship IDE for full-fledged ABAP development.

General availability is planned for Q2, 2026.

 

Join the Future of ABAP Development

These four innovations mark a major step toward a unified, intelligent, and modern ABAP development experience.

With Agentic AI, release-independent ABAP AI capabilities, and VS Code for ABAP, we‚Äôre redefining how developers create intelligent enterprise solutions with ABAP.

Learn more about the new developments in ABAP here.

entry.title: The SAP Extended Warehouse Management FAQ Series: Robotic Integration for EWM
entry.content:
With the request to further increase the level of automation in modern and high-performance warehouses integration of robotics to warehouse management solutions becomes increasingly relevant.

This demand is leading to the question on how to best and most efficiently integrate robotics, fleet management systems and multi-agent orchestration platforms to SAP Extended Warehouse Management for SAP S/4HANA Cloud, private edition.

With this blog post, we would like to discuss some of the most important and relevant questions of the topic of robotic integration to SAP EWM.

What is the right integration technology to integrate robotic systems to SAP EWM?

With SAP EWM there are multiple channels and interfacing options that should be evaluated when integrating robotics and the corresponding fleet management systems.

Typically, robot platforms are integrated via OData APIs, EWM-WCU IDOC interface or via SOAP Webservices and RFCs. Further AGV, AMR and robots can be integrated using MFS over TCP/IP and telegram-based communication. Find further information about available EWM interfaces and specific features and functions via the following links:

  • OData APIs for EWM: Find a list of available ODATA Services for EWM via SAP Help ‚Äì SAP S/4HANA - APIs for Warehousing or via the SAP Business Accelerator Hub.
  • EWM WCU IDoc Interface: Find a list of available IDocs for EWM via SAP Help ‚Äì SAP S/4HANA - Interface Between EWM and Non-SAP Systems.
  • SOAP Webservices for EWM: Find a list of available SOAP for EWM via SAP Help ‚Äì SAP S/4HANA - Enterprise Services in Extended Warehouse Management.

The choice of the integration technology is majorly influenced by the dedicated robotic vendor (integration to sub-systems), partner solution, requirement against end-to-end visibility, type of robotic integrated/primary function (e.g. mobile robot, manipulation robots, cognitive robots, etc.), size and heterogeny of robotic fleet.

Is there a best-practice architecture for robotic integration?

While the robotics integration is highly depending on the aspects mentioned before in the warehouse context the following types of robots are typically used (listed based on primary function):

  • Mobile Robots: Robots moving through the warehouse such as AMR (Autonomous Mobile Robots), AGV (Automated Guided Vehicles)
  • Manipulation Robots: Robots that physical handle and move items such as picking robots, sorting robots and palletizing/depalletizing robots.

In case there are larger and heterogenous robotic fleets integrated to warehouse solutions there are often Fleet Management Systems (FMS) or Multiagent Orchestration Platforms (MOP) from SAP Partners required to orchestrate and dispatch Workload (Warehouse Orders/Tasks) amongst the integrated fleet, performing position management, analytics, routing and training of robots.

Additionally, there are partner solutions on the market that are specialized on industries and process variants such as eCommerce small parts picking, which can be integrated according to a Black Box-integration pattern (EWM viewpoint), as Warehouse Orders/Tasks are optimized and dispatched via the Fleet Management System (FMS) to an integrated robotic solution (e.g. assisted picking robots).

Considering above mentioned aspects, the following integration patterns are most common and best suiting to the requirements of robotic integration:

                Event-Driven Integration

The event-driven integration considers direct distribution of relevant workload via the Warehouse Order Business Event (available with SAP S/4HANA 2025, FPS0) to the SAP Event Mesh on SAP BTP. From the SAP Event Mesh the Fleet Manager System (FMS) can pick-up the relevant Warehouse Order creation, cancelation, activation or deletion events to initiate retrieving relevant Warehouse Orders.

The integration follows the following steps:

  1. Create warehouse task/- order for movement from source to destination
  • Source and Destination are FMS managed
  • Determine FMS relevant queue for execution
  1. Push Warehouse Order Business Event to SAP Event Mesh
  2. FMS to register for the relevant Warehouse Order Business Event from SAP Event Mesh
  3. Perform Warehouse Order/Warehouse Tasks retrieval from FMS for relevant Warehouse Orders via the Warehousing API (GET)
  4. Start execution of the Warehouse Order/Warehouse Tasks by updating the operating resource to the Warehouse Order (e.g. FMS or specific robot-unit) by the Warehousing API (POST) (optional)
  5. Confirm Warehouse Order/Warehouse Tasks by FMS by the Warehousing API (POST)

Direct Integration

In basic concept of the direct integration is to either send created Warehouse Orders/Warehouse Tasks to a Fleet Management System (FMS) or retrieve Warehouse Orders/Tasks by the Fleet Management System (FMS).

The integration follows the following steps:

  1. Create warehouse task/- order for movement from source to destination
  • Source and Destination are FMS managed
  • Determine FMS relevant queue for execution
  1. FMS to select open Warehouse Orders/Warehouse Tasks regularly from queue via EWM interface (e.g. ODATA-service, WebService, IDoc).
  2. Start execution of the Warehouse Order/Warehouse Tasks by setting updating the operating resource to the Warehouse Order (e.g. FMS or specific robot-unit)
  3. Confirm Warehouse Order/Warehouse Tasks by FMS

Additionally, there are project-based integrations possible, to integrate robotics via MFS-telegrams or with small robotic fleets to directly integrate robots to EWM.

What is the typical SAP EWM configuration required for robotic integration?

To enable transparency and optimized integration the following customizing is typically configured in SAP EWM:

  • Queues and Queue determination criteria for robots
  • Resource Types for robots
  • Resource Groups for robots
  • Queue sequence for robot‚Äôs Resource Group
  • Resource for robot

Implementation of the following interface functions to connect robots with SAP EWM:

  • Push Warehouse Order Events (create, change, delete, activate) to FMS
  • Retrieve Warehouse Orders
  • Assign Robot to Warehouse Order
  • Confirm Warehouse Orders

We are currently evaluating further enhancements to standard functionality on SAP EWM roadmap to improve integration to robotic fleets to enable for a more robust and dynamic integration.

Are there partner solutions available to integutions to SAP EWM most efficiently?

We have partner solutions offering proven integration concepts and contents available via our SAP Store with the following partners:

Partner

Solution

Locus Robotics, Inc.

Locus Autonomous Mobile Robots for SAP EWM

Geekplus Technology Co., Ltd.

Improve efficiency of your warehouse operation by 2 to 3 times

DXC Technology Services LLC

DXC Smart Warehouse EWM Integration with AGVs

Flexus AG

AGV-Hub - Fleet Manager for Mobile Robots

KINEXON Industries GmbH

Connect and automate operations: redefine manufacturing & logistics efficiency

Roboteon Inc.

Roboteon Fulfillment Platform

Beside these there are implementation accelerators and partner solutions available from our partner ecosystem that are not listed yet in the SAP Store.

What is the future of robotic integration with SAP EWM?

With advancing technology both in logistics, business solutions and robotics, new ways of integration are explored and driven forward. SAP‚Äôs initiative to combine advanced robotics with enhanced sensorics and AI capabilities ‚Äì cognitive robots ‚Äì and AI-infused logistics solutions leads the way towards new opportunities for automation.

BITZER, NEURA Robotics and SAP went live with a proof-of-concept solution to integrate embodied AI agents to EWM for SAP S/4HANA Cloud, private edition. The proof-of-concept validates Joule-based multi-agent orchestration and execution via the humanoid robot 4NE1 for a picking workflow including visual inspection, enabling agentic situation handling according to the business process and priorities. If you would like to learn more about via SAP News - SAP Expands Physical AI Partnerships and Demonstrates Success of New Robotics Pilots. 

If you would like to learn more about robotic integration, please find more information via SAP Community Blog Enhancing warehouse operations by integrating robotics with SAP Extended Warehouse Management or stay tuned for further release updates and posts.

entry.title: Evolution of Data and Analytics with SAP Business Data Cloud
entry.content:
Introduction to Business Data Cloud:

SAP Business Data Cloud was introduced on February 13 2025 as Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) solution fully managed by SAP. SAP Business Data Cloud is a data & analytics platform that harmonizes all data from SAP and non-SAP sources into a unified semantic layer of trusted data that governs, connects and share data securely across systems or cloud. By integrating powerful functionality of SAP Datasphere, SAP Analytics Cloud, and SAP Databricks and SAP Business Warehouse. It empowers businesses to break data silos to power advanced AI and analytics.

Why was Business data cloud introduced?

  • To get easier access to SAP data without the need for complex data preparation steps such as extraction, building semantics, transformation and loading data for analytics.
  • To get access to all SAP data from all Line of Business (LoB) applications, such as SAP S/4HANA, SAP SuccessFactors and SAP Ariba without the need of 3rd party connector & tool.
  • To get a unified business view of the data regardless of which SAP application it originated from without making harmonization difficult and holds its original business context without any change.
  • To accelerate AI with trusted and secure data that they can use to build reliable AI applications to accelerate innovation and insights with AI.
  • To get faster access to SAP data insights by removing data preparation and dashboard building steps.
  • To get a Simplified Landscape by reducing multiple tools, silos and complex tasks of manual data preparation, development and analytics.

Key Features & Capabilities of Business Data Cloud: 

SAP Business Data Cloud Key Innovation of out-of-the-box components

  • Intelligent Applications: Intelligent Applications are predefined, SAP-managed dashboards for analytics based on underlying Data Products and models.
  • Data Products: Create and share governed, reusable data products that deliver consistent, high-quality business information across teams and systems.
  • BDC Cockpit: Centrally manage your data products, monitor usage, and enforce governance policies, all from one intuitive interface.

SAP Business Data Cloud Integrated Software components:

  • SAP Datasphere: to provide the data integration and modelling.
  • SAP Analytics Cloud: to provide the analysis and planning.
  • SAP Databricks: to provide AI and machine learning enhancements.
  • SAP BW/BW4HANA: can be used as a data source for datasphere & databricks.

SAP Business Data Cloud is built on SAP Business Technology Platform:

  • Unified Customer Landscape used to connect the SAP Business Data Cloud components.
  • SAP HANA Cloud provides the data storage layer.
  • SAP Security and Compliance to manage access and permissions and governs regulatory compliance.
  • SAP Development & Integration to provide developer tools for modelling & data Integration
  • SAP AI & Analytics to provide advanced analytics and AI powered insights.

SAP Business Data Cloud Architecture:

  • Source System layer: It harmonizes all data from SAP and non-SAP sources, into a unified semantic layer of trusted data, to power advanced analytics and to build AI applications.
  • Foundation Service Layer: This layer replicates and harmonizes data from the source systems to produce curated, governed Data Products that retain their original business context. Data products are grouped by Data Packages to make it easy to discover them and to activate them. This data is stored in a hyper scaler environment using SAP HANA Cloud and Data Lake files.
  • Business Data Fabric Layer: It combines the strengths of SAP Datasphere, SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC), and SAP Business Warehouse (BW) capabilities, enhanced by the Databricks platform to unify an organization with SAP and Non ‚Äì SAP and third-party data into a single, trusted foundation model.
  • SAP Datasphere is the technological foundation for the business data fabric within BDC. It integrates, transforms, and enriches data from SAP and non-SAP sources into powerful semantic models. Data can be replicated into Datasphere for faster performance or accessed virtually from its source, allowing for flexible management of a hybrid data landscape.
  • SAP Databricks is an Advanced AI and machine learning technology. It provides a pro-code environment for data engineers and AI developers to build, train, and deploy custom AI and ML models using the rich, semantically aware data from SAP applications.
  • SAP Business Warehouse (BW) or BW/4HANA: For customers with existing on-premises SAP Business Warehouse (BW) or BW/4HANA systems, this component provides a modernization path within the Business Data Fabric. A Data Product Generator can be used to convert BW Info Provider data into cloud-ready data products, which can then be consumed by Datasphere for analytics or by Databricks for AI/ML.
  • SAP Business Data Cockpit: SAP Business Data Cloud cockpit allows you to browse and find pre delivered Intelligent Applications and data products, install Intelligent Applications, and share data products with SAP Datasphere & Databricks to enable analytics & enrich with AI and machine learning capabilities.
  • Intelligent Application Layer: It‚Äôs a unified semantic layer of trusted data, to power advanced AI & Analytics.
  • SAP Analytical Cloud: Using SAP Analytics Cloud, business users can run ad-hoc analysis, explore the provided data with AI-driven chat capabilities, or act on their insights with AI-driven suggestions, bridging the gap between analytics and their end-to-end business processes.
  • Intelligent Application: SAP Business Data Cloud Intelligent Applications are used to provide the required dashboard in out-of-the-box reporting scenarios with its advanced visualization and planning functions
  • Joule: Joule uses natural language processing to interact, access insights, and perform tasks across SAP and third-party applications. It uses "agents" and "skills" to automate multi-step workflows and provide contextual assistance.

How SAP Business Data Cloud work as one domain model:

Scenario 1: Out-of-the-Box model with Datasphere

Step 1: The first step is to identify the right intelligent application for your business scenario, In SAP Business Data Cloud cockpit search for available intelligent application and install the one that meets your requirement.

Step 2: When intelligent application installation is initiated the relevant business data that has already been bundled into a package in your business application is accessed and replicated to the Foundation Services of SAP Business Data Cloud.

Step 3: Inside the Foundation Services, the replicated business data is harmonized with other data packages from different business applications such as SAP SuccessFactors the data is transformed and enriched to become a data product. The data is now ready to be used as the basis for analysis.

Step 4: In SAP Datasphere all artifacts necessary for the analysis are now automatically generated on top of the Data Product. 

Step 5: Visual representations of the insights are automatically generated and made available in the intelligent application dashboard.

 Scenario 2:  AI and machine learning enhancement by Databricks

Step 1: The first step is to identify the right intelligent application for your business scenario, In SAP Business Data Cloud cockpit search for available intelligent application and install the one that meets your requirement.

Step 2: When intelligent application installation is initiated the relevant business data that has already been bundled into a package in your business application is accessed and replicated to the Foundation Services of SAP Business Data Cloud.

Step 3: Inside the Foundation Services, the replicated business data is harmonized with other data packages from different business applications such as SAP SuccessFactors the data is transformed and enriched to become a data product. The data is now ready to be used as the basis for analysis.

Step 4: In SAP Datasphere all artifacts necessary for the analysis are now automatically generated on top of the Data Product. 

Step 5: Visual representations of the insights are automatically generated and made available in the intelligent application dashboard.

Step 6: Integration of SAP Databricks

It is possible to extend the results shown in the dashboard with machine learning and AI based Insights, to do so use the SAP business data cockpit to share data product with databricks,

In SAP Databricks AI and Machine learning techniques are used to generate the desired result, this results then shared back to the data model and extend your dashboard with AI and Machine learning insights.

Scenario 2:  : Integration of SAP BW & SAP Analytical Cloud

Step 1: The first step is to identify the right intelligent application for your business scenario, In SAP BDC cockpit search for available intelligent application and install the one that meets your requirement.

Step 2: When intelligent application installation is initiated the relevant business data that has already been bundled into a package in your business application is accessed and replicated to the Foundation Services of SAP Business Data Cloud.

Step 3: Inside the Foundation Services, the replicated business data is harmonized with other data packages from different business applications such as SAP SuccessFactors the data is transformed and enriched to become a data product. The data is now ready to be used as the basis for analysis.

Step 4: In SAP Datasphere all artifacts necessary for the analysis are now automatically generated on top of the Data Product. 

Step 5: This is where the integration of your third-party data comes into play. The advanced integration and data modelling capabilities of SAP Datasphere allow you to integrate your third-party data into the out-of-the-box data model.

Step 6: Integration of SAP BW

It is also possible to integrate your existing objects from SAP BW/4HANA into SAP Business Data Cloud. With a dedicated data provisioning tool, you can onboard your SAP BW objects into SAP Datasphere and combine them with the existing data model.

Step 7: Integration of SAP Analytical Cloud 

SAP Business Data Cloud provides a wide range of consumption options on top of your data model. Use the AI-based Just Ask feature in SAP Analytics Cloud. The power of its natural language processing allows you to request information from your data model simply by typing a question about your data. Answers are instantly displayed in the most appropriate format.

Use Case of Business Data Cloud:

SAP Business Data Cloud can handle many use-cases including:

  • Data Integration & Modelling 
  • Data Governance and Compliance 
  • Development of AI and machine learning models
  • Data Warehousing
  • Planning and BI 
  • Development of intelligent applications to support all business processes.
  • End-to-end data lifecycle management by SAP 

SAP Business Data Cloud reaches all personas of the organization.

Conclusion: 

Data from all SAP applications is combined and made available to the businesses under a single domain model. With SAP Business Data Cloud, SAP has reached the next level of data and analytics evolution to tackle challenges and enables businesses to seamlessly integrate, harmonize, and analyse data from multiple sources, transforming raw data into valuable insights with advanced AI and analytics. 

By adopting the latest 2025 features, organizations can accelerate analytics, improve decision-making, and prepare for AI-driven innovation.

How AI is Transforming Your Digital Workspace

Introduction

The modern workplace has changed dramatically. Employees no longer rely solely on static intranets or scattered collaboration tools. Instead, they expect a connected, personalized experience that helps them cut through the noise and focus on meaningful work. Enter artificial intelligence (AI).

AI isn‚Äôt just another layer of technology- it‚Äôs rapidly becoming the backbone of digital workspaces. By surfacing the right information at the right time, automating repetitive tasks, and enabling smarter collaboration and self-service, AI is redefining how we work, learn, and engage every day.

With digital workspaces in SAP Build, these AI capabilities are already available today‚Äîhelping organizations deliver intelligent, personalized employee experiences out of the box

The Rise of AI in the Digital Workspace

For years, digital workspaces have been a central hub for business applications, documents, apps, and communications in one place. Useful‚Äîbut often overwhelming. Employees spent as much time searching for information as they did, acting on it.

Now, AI is filling the gaps. With intelligent copilots, content curation, and contextual answers, digital workspaces like SAP Build Work Zone have evolved from being a destination for information into an engine for productivity and engagement.

Core AI features available today in SAP Build digital workspaces

1. Chatbots & Virtual Assistants
With Joule, SAP‚Äôs AI copilot, workspace users can access information instantly. From answering HR questions to surfacing insights from reports, employees can rely on conversational AI to get what they need instantaneously.

Joule, SAP's AI copilot integrated into the digital workspace

2. Task completion with Joule Skills

One can enhance Joule capabilities by creating skills for it in Joule Studio. Connected with SAP systems and third-party applications, Joule can complete tasks like submitting time-off requests, approving workflows, or surfacing KPI dashboards‚Äîall from a single interface

  

3. Document Grounding Capabilities
Joule ensures information is both contextual and reliable when using workspace content to ground AI responses. For example, employees can ask ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs our travel policy in Europe?‚Äù and receive an AI response sourced directly from workspace content or SAP SuccessFactors policies when it is enabled as an AI source.

  

4. Content generation and summarization using generative AI
SAP Build leverages generative AI to help users create and refine content‚Äîwhether drafting announcements, summarizing updates, or suggesting language for a blog post‚Äîdirectly within the workspace.

  

 

 

 

 

Real-Life Examples in Action

  • Information access with grounded responses

Joule responds with answers grounded in the specific workspace content. Employees can query Joule with specific questions like ‚ÄúWhat is the holiday plan for next year in Germany" or ‚Äúhow can I apply for a sabbatical leave? Point me to the relevant file‚Äù.

  • Smart document summaries

Integrated AI services capture the highlights of a workspace document‚Äîpolicy highlights, key insights from data, or high-level overview of a blog.

  • Workflow Automation

From within SAP Build workspace, an employee can ask Joule to ‚Äúcreate a purchase order‚Äù or ‚Äúshow current pipeline metrics.‚Äù The copilot triggers the workflow in connected SAP systems, making productivity seamless.

  • Intelligent content curation

Users can easily create blog posts, feed posts or even knowledge articles in the workspace using the native AI features with simple prompts like ‚Äúcreate a workspace feed reminding members to fill their timesheet in a funny and casual tone‚Äù.

The Business Impact

  • Faster Information Access: Joule makes information searches 95% faster by surfacing insights and data instantly. Grounded insights reduce time spent searching for answers.
  • Reduced Manual Effort: Generative AI-assisted summarization and content creation free up employee time.
  • Better Governance: AI responses in SAP are backed by enterprise content, ensuring compliance and accuracy.

Preparing for the AI-Powered Workspace

Adopting AI in digital workspaces is not just about flipping a switch‚Äîit‚Äôs about preparing your organization:

  • Change Management: Train employees to adopt AI workflows and copilots in their daily work.
  • Governance: Define guardrails for AI-generated content, data privacy, and security.
  • Integration: Maximize value by connecting SAP Build with existing SAP and non-SAP applications, making copilots more powerful.

Conclusion

AI is no longer a future trend; it‚Äôs already embedded in the digital workspaces employees use today. With embedded AI and Joule, organizations don‚Äôt just imagine an intelligent workspace‚Äîthey experience it

By weaving AI into daily workflows‚Äîwhether through copilots, recommended learning, or curated content‚ÄîSAP Build helps organizations unlock productivity, agility, and engagement at scale.

Ready to take the next step?
